First Kurdish-Iraqi War.Location: Iraqi Kurdistan, (nominally Iraqi Republic (1958-68) and Baathist Iraq)
First Kurdish-Iraqi War.Result: Stalemate | Several Iraqi offensives intended to suppress the Kurdish rebellion fail. | Iraqi-Kurdish Autonomy Agreement
First Kurdish-Iraqi War: Part of the Iraqi-Kurdish conflict and the Arab-Israeli conflict

Belligerents.KDP | Iraqi Communist Party (From 1963): Before 1968 | Republic of Iraq | Syria | Syria (1963) | After 1968 | Ba'athist Iraq | Saladin Knights | Talabani faction (From 1966)

Commanders and leaders: Mustafa Barzani | Ibrahim Ahmad (Until 1964) | Jalal Talabani (Until 1964) | Ali Askari | Kamal Mufti | Abdul Karim Qasim (1958-1963) | Ahmed Hassan al-Bakr (1963) | Abdul Salam Arif (1963-1966) | Abdul Rahman Arif (1966-1968)
